column2: Bundi  Jaipuri Quilt/ Razai  Hand Block Printed and Handmade ~ Single Size 60X90 Inches
column14: Bundi  Jaipuri Quilt/ Razai  Hand Block Printed and Handmade ~ Single Size 60X90 Inches: Amazon.in: Home & Kitchen
column15: Bundi  Jaipuri Quilt/ Razai  Hand Block Printed and Handmade ~ Single Size 60X90 Inches: Amazon.in: Home & Kitchen
column17:
Product Description

Hand Stitched light weight quilts filled with cotton padding. These quilts are perfect for summers and can be layered for winters. Made with the softest voile cotton they are luxurious to cuddle up with. About These Quilts & History : The art of block printing began in the 18th century in Rajasthan and the craft has been passed down from generation to generation. The finest contemporary block printing is still found in this area. Block printing has become popular because it can create intricate design depth and texture in rich and vibrant colors. The main tools of the printer are wooden blocks in different shapes. Each block is hand carved from seasoned teak wood by skilled artisans. The new blocks are soaked in oil for 10-15 days to soften the grain in the timber. The filling is finely carded cotton which has had all the impurities removed. In the process of carding a dense cotton ball becomes light and fluffy. To make a quilt a worker will start with approximately 2.2 lbs. of cotton. After undergoing carding for a week only about 3.5 ounces of cotton remain. The cotton is separated into as many cotton fibers as possible. This light fluffy cotton is what makes these quilts so warm. nce the cotton is fully carded the artisans are ready to assemble the quilts. The quilts must have several layers of very thin and fluffy cotton evenly distributed throughout the quilt. This is an essential step to maintain the comfort and warmth of the quilts which are 100% cotton. Once the filling is evenly distributed the quilt is stitched together and quilted by hand. Hope you enjoy this quilt as much as we enjoyed creating it! xoxo

column15: That  Jaipuri Quilt/ Razai  Hand Block Printed and Handmade ~ Single Size 60X90 Inches: Amazon.in: Home & Kitchen
column17:
Product Description

Hand Stitched light weight quilts filled with cotton padding. These quilts are perfect for summers and can be layered for winters. Made with the softest voile cotton they are luxurious to cuddle up with. About These Quilts & History : The art of block printing began in the 18th century in Rajasthan and the craft has been passed down from generation to generation. The finest contemporary block printing is still found in this area. Block printing has become popular because it can create intricate design depth and texture in rich and vibrant colors. The main tools of the printer are wooden blocks in different shapes. Each block is hand carved from seasoned teak wood by skilled artisans. The new blocks are soaked in oil for 10-15 days to soften the grain in the timber. The filling is finely carded cotton which has had all the impurities removed. In the process of carding a dense cotton ball becomes light and fluffy. To make a quilt a worker will start with approximately 2.2 lbs. of cotton. After undergoing carding for a week only about 3.5 ounces of cotton remain. The cotton is separated into as many cotton fibers as possible. This light fluffy cotton is what makes these quilts so warm. nce the cotton is fully carded the artisans are ready to assemble the quilts. The quilts must have several layers of very thin and fluffy cotton evenly distributed throughout the quilt. This is an essential step to maintain the comfort and warmth of the quilts which are 100% cotton. Once the filling is evenly distributed the quilt is stitched together and quilted by hand. Hope you enjoy this quilt as much as we enjoyed creating it! xoxo

column2: Tamluk  Vintage Handmade Patch Worked Kantha Quilt/Throw 85X65 Inches  Medium to Heavy Weight ~ kinche Special!
column14: Tamluk  Vintage Handmade Patch Worked Kantha Quilt/Throw 85X65 Inches  Medium to Heavy Weight ~ kinche Special!: Amazon.in: Home & Kitchen
column15: Tamluk  Vintage Handmade Patch Worked Kantha Quilt/Throw 85X65 Inches  Medium to Heavy Weight ~ kinche Special!: Amazon.in: Home & Kitchen
column17:
Product Description

All kinche Special* pieces are handpicked and cannot be replicated. Each piece took more than 3 months to prepare and actual antiques. A perfect gift for someone who loves textiles! Use them to adorn your living room as a light blanket or for travelling. You can also frame them to adorn your wall. Women in Bengal typically use old saris and cloth and layer them with kantha stitch to make a light blanket throw or bedspread. Kantha is very popular with tourists visiting Bengal and is a specialty of Bolpur Kolkata. -a testament to its quality and hand-craftsmanship. It is believed the artisan sews wishes into the fabric with each stitch. We wish you enjoy using our quilts as much as we enjoyed sourcing them for you! :)
